alert.note: Alert for Defiance (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 01 at 7:31PM EDT until June 01 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Ohio, including the following counties, Defiance, Henry, Paulding and Putnam. * WHEN...Until 830 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 727 PM EDT, Thunderstorms that were bringing heavy rainfall have moved out of the area. However, minor flooding impacts may still be occuring over the next hour of so. - Radar estimated totals of 1.5 to 2.5 inches of rainfall in the area were noted. The heaviest amounts were centered near North Creek. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Paulding, Continental, Oakwood, Grover Hill, Dupont, Melrose, Latty, Broughton, New Bavaria, Charloe, Arthur, Mandale, Roselms, Wisterman, North Creek, Kieferville and Pleasant Bend. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
